data_footnote: The data for the last year are provisional
graph_title: Manufacturing employment as a proportion of total employment
indicator_name: Manufacturing employment as a proportion of total employment

sources.url_text: Survey on the population in relation to activity

indicador_disponible: Manufacturing employment as a proportion of total employment
objetivo_global: 9- Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
meta_global: 9.2 Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and, by 2030, significantly raise industry’s share of employment and gross domestic product, in line with national circumstances, and double its share in least developed countries
definicion: Proportion of people employed in the manufacturing sector with respect to the total number of employed people
formula:
$$PPO_{manufacturing}^{t} = \frac{PO_{manufacturing}^{t}}{PO^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where:

$PO_{manufacturing}^{t} = population employed in the manufacturing sector (section C of the National 
Classification of Economic Activities (CNAE-2009)) in year $t$

$PO^{t} =$ employed population in year $t$
texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
justificacion_global:
This indicator conveys the contribution of manufacturing in total employment. It measures the 
ability of the manufacturing sector to absorb surplus labour from agricultural and other traditional 
sectors. However, in developed countries an opposite trend is expected where emphasis has shifted 
to reduction in labor in manufacturing as part of cost-cutting measures, to promote more capital-intensive 
industries. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
dato_global: Empleo manufacturero como proporción del empleo total - 13.ª CIET (%) SL_TLF_MANF UNSTATS
comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with United Nations metadata.

es.indicador_disponible: Manufacturing employment as a proportion of total employment
es.objetivo_global: 9- Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
es.meta_global: 9.2 Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and, by 2030, significantly raise industry’s share of employment and gross domestic product, in line with national circumstances, and double its share in least developed countries
es.definicion: Proporción de personas ocupadas en el sector manufacturero respecto al total de personas ocupadas
es.formula:
$$PPO_{manufacturero}^{t} = \frac{PO_{manufacturero}^{t}}{PO^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde:

$PO_{manufacturero}^{t} =$ población ocupada en el sector manufacturero (sección C de la CNAE-2009) en el año $t$

$PO^{t} =$ población ocupada en el año $t$
es.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
es.justificacion_global:
Este indicador refleja la contribución de la industria manufacturera al empleo total. 
Mide la capacidad del sector manufacturero para absorber el excedente de mano de obra 
de la agricultura y otros sectores tradicionales. Sin embargo, en los países 
desarrollados se espera una tendencia opuesta, donde el énfasis se ha desplazado 
hacia la reducción de la mano de obra en la industria manufacturera como parte 
de las medidas de reducción de costos, para promover industrias más intensivas en 
capital.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
es.dato_global: Empleo manufacturero como proporción del empleo total - 13.ª CIET (%) SL_TLF_MANF UNSTATS
es.comparabilidad: El indicador disponible cumple con los metadatos del indicador de Naciones Unidas.
